text: The 1967 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented Fresno State CollegeCalifornia State University, Fresno was known as Fresno State College from 1949 to 1971. during the 1967 NCAA College Division football season. The team was led by second-year head coach Darryl Rogers and played home games at Ratcliffe Stadium on the campus of Fresno City College in Fresno, California. They finished the season with a record of three wins and eight losses (3–8, 3–2 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== The following were selected in the 1968 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Mike Freeman || Defensive back || 4 || 89 || Minnesota Vikings |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Len McNeil || Guard || 4 || 95 || Philadelphia Eagles |} ==Notes== ==References== Fresno State Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Fresno State Bulldogs f
